Requirement: The bare die of the chip should be square
The bare die of the chip should be less than or equal to 2.4mm x 2.4mm in area
Notes: Maximum die size constraint for implantable applications

Requirement: The chip shall be available in a 6mm x 6mm 52-pin QFN package
Notes: Package option for testing and general use

Requirement: The chip shall be available in a 3mm x 3mm 49-pin BGA package
Notes: Package option for highly constrained implant use

Requirement: The chip shall be optimised for low power operation
The chip shall operate from a 2.4V to 4.2V supply using an integrated 1.8V LDO
The chip shall be optimised for implantable usage
Notes: Small footprint and low power for biomedical implants

Requirement: The chip shall be optimised for recording low frequency intracranial brain activity
Notes: Target frequency range: 0.1-1Hz to 250Hz, target noise less than 1uVrms in the 0.5-50Hz band

Requirement: The chip shall support long-term recording of biopotential signals
The chip should support safety critical biopotential monitoring
The chip shall be suitable for closed-loop deep brain stimulation applications
The chip must be able to operate in monopolar (single reference) or bipolar (fully differential channels) modes
The chip shall be designed to facilitate testing and characterisation of each sub block of its design
Notes: Non-production chip that will be characterised in depth to understand the performance of various IP blocks

Requirement: The chip shall support a range of gains to allow users to optimise power-performance tradeoffs
The chip shall support a range of resolutions to allow users to optimise power-performance tradeoffs
The chip shall support a range of sampling rates to allow users to optimise power-performance tradeoffs
Notes: 0.5 kS/s to 256 kS/s per channel (10-bit mode)

Requirement: The chip shall provide 8 independent differential sensing channels
The chip shall support bi-polar tri-polar and multi-polar electrode configurations
Notes: Flexible electrode interfacing via input multiplexer

Requirement: The chip shall achieve low input referred noise of approximately 1µVrms in the EEG band (0.5-50Hz)
Notes: Noise performance target for neural signal quality

Requirement: The chip shall provide high input impedance of at least 30M? at 1kHz
The chip shall provide a high-pass filter corner frequency less than 0.2Hz
Notes: DC rejection and baseline wander removal

Requirement: The chip shall provide adjustable low-pass filter corner frequency from 100Hz to 300Hz
The chip shall achieve CMRR of at least 60dB across the signal bandwidth
The chip shall achieve PSRR of at least 70dB with integrated LDO
The chip shall provide 14-bit effective resolution (ENOB) for neural signal acquisition
The chip shall have gain variation (due to drift and across expected operating temperature) of less than 10% of nominal.
Notes: Clinical standard for intracranial EEG monitoring - 80601-2-26

Requirement: The chip shall accept signal amplitudes of at least 20mV peak to peak
Notes: Seizure induced oscillations and intramuscular EMG amplitudes

Requirement: The chip shall tolerate a common mode range greater than 300mV.
The chip shall demonstrate gain flatness within +0.8dB and -3dB across the bandwith of 0.5-50Hz
Notes: Clinical standard for intracranial EEG monitoring - 80601-2-26

Requirement: The chip shall support a range of standard clock frequencies that are powers of 2 or multiples of 100Hz
Notes: Ease of system integration (part availability, size, power, etc) and/or generation by embedded platforms

Requirement: The chip shall derive a sampling rate from an external clock and either be a power of 2 in Hz or a multiple of 100
Notes: Ease of data analysis and algorithm development, compatibility and synchronisation with other systems

Requirement: The chip shall sample data with a resolution smaller than 3uV
Notes: Smallest oscillations are expected to be ~10uV

Requirement: The chip shall use a standard SPI interface for configuration and data readout
The chip shall support SPI clock speeds up to 25MHz
The chip shall operate reliably across the full specified temperature range (at least 18°C – 50°C)
The chip shall provide robust operation suitable for bio-electronic medicine applications
When operating within its specified operating conditions the chip shall limit currents passing through electrodes to less than 3.75uA
Notes:
Suitable for 5mm2 electrodes. BS EN 45502-1:2015 (Implants for surgery — Active implantable medical devices), 
section 16.2:  “Except for its intended function, implantable parts of an ACTIVE IMPLANTABLE MEDICAL DEVICE shall be electrically neutral when in contact with the body.  The direct current density at the surface of any conductive surface or electrode shall be ? 0,75?A/mm 2 ”

Requirement: The chip should be so designed and manufactured that it remains SINGLE FAULT SAFE
The chip shall detect if any channel of amplification goes into saturation and provide an indication of this
Notes: Clinical standard for intracranial EEG monitoring - 80601-2-26

Requirement: The chip should detect whether any lead wires become disconnected and provide an indication of this
Notes: Clinical standard for intracranial EEG monitoring - 80601-2-26
